subject: Climate & Environment
title: Hazardous Waste and Health
description: A micro-lesson that makes Hazardous Waste and Health usable.

hook.text: Every year, 300 million tons of hazardous waste are produced globally. Much of it is mismanaged.

buildup.text: Chemical plants, hospitals, and factories generate waste containing heavy metals and toxins.

discovery.text: When improperly stored, these toxins leak into groundwater and contaminate soil for decades.

twist.text: Love Canal in New York â€” built over a toxic dump â€” made residents sick for generations.

climax.text: Strict regulation works. The US Superfund program has cleaned over 400 toxic sites since 1980.

punchline.text: What we bury carelessly today, our children inherit tomorrow.
